captions.text:
And today we decided
to do a twin tag.

We thought it looked
like so much fun.

And since not very
many people can do it--

-We decided we can do
it because we're twins.

-And plus, we get a ton of
questions about being twins.

-This is the video
to watch if you

have any questions
about being twins.

And I just want to say
something really quick.

I was outside and now my
nose is all congested.

So if I sound really
funny, don't laugh.

-Usually I'm the one
sick, but this time--

and I have all my questions
written down on my--
Let's see, which one is older?

If you have an older sister
or brother you would know.

I'm smarter because I'm
older-- and it's two minutes.
of having someone to pick on.

-The second question
is, are we twins?

We are just born on the same
day, look exactly the same--

-From the same mom
at the same time.

The third question is, are you
identical or fraternal twins?

And for you guys who
don't know what that is,

a fraternal twin
is a twin that--
but I won't get into it.

-Usually it's boy-girl, and
obviously they're not identical

I'm not going to go into
detail, but they are fraternal.

And then usually identical
could be a boy-boy, girl-girl.

Even fraternal twins can
be boy-boy, girl-girl,

-Again, not going
into detail, but we

are technically the same
person but we are not alike,

-Let's see, fourth question--
which is better at sports?

But the upside to
being better at sports

is that I'm more competitive,
I get into more things.

But then I happen to
be not so great at--

-So that's where she
comes in and she helps me

-And so I teach her all
my actual things on her--

-She can throw a
football pretty well.

She taught me how
to throw a spiral.
I can throw a spiral now, guys.

Well, she helps me pick out
my outfits in the morning.

We're both kind of good at
both, but she's better at sports
the twin gene run in our family?

We have a like a great, great
grandpa on my mom's side.

But on my dad's side, my dad is
a fraternal twin with a girl,

and then we have cousins
on my dad's side.
So my dad's sister has twins.

Just to say, our dad has
like three or four pairs

-So yes, it does
run in the family.

So we came out identical
and my dad is fraternal.

OK, the next question
is, do your names match?

-So you could say we match,
because we both start with B.

I do know actually at one point
I think my parents had a theme.

Because at one point
they were going

to name me
[? Kennedy and her Kaylee. ?]

-And I was going
to be [? Kaylee. ?]
-So there was like a K going on.

-It was the first
letter matching thing

that they must have
been going for.

But then something
happened and that changed,

and now I'm Brooklyn
and that's Bailey.

So I'm guessing
probably yes, our names

do match because they
both start with B.

This is kind of an
awkward question.

because I guess it's
healthier that way?

It was something
about our butts.

-I wasn't the one with
the kids in my stomach.

Number eight, do we have
our own twin language?

-It's kind of like
having a best friend.

-You know with your best
friend you can look at them.

-There's a thousand words
for that look, you know?

-I can look at her and be
like-- raise an eyebrow,

And she can go, uh hm, uh
hm, during class and stuff.

-Because it's your face
and not really your mouth.

We don't have a
language like that.

-Oh, but we sort of do have
our own language in a way.

I remember my parents saying--
they told us this story.

We were younger and we
were together in a crib.

-I would climb out of my
crib and sit next to her.

-No, you couldn't
climb out of your crib.

She doesn't know what
she's talking about.

So my mom would take her
and put her in my crib.

But then we wouldn't sleep
that way because we would talk,

I don't know if I we can
show that to you someday.

I would be like ya, ya,
ya, you know, like babies.

And then Bailey would reply
with her own la, la, la.

So apparently we could
understand each other

in baby language, so
maybe that counts?

-But once you're 14,
it's not really a thing.

My mom used to think it
was so cute to buy us

When you're younger, like
twins matching is adorable.

Yeah, but then
like 14 years old,

we come to school
looking the exact same.
That's just a tiny bit weird.

-We always try to switch
on April Fool's Day

because obviously we can
because we're identical girls.

-I try to convince her
every year to switch,

-And then everyone knows
that we're going to switch.

-Anyway, so in first
grade we switched

and it actually went
over really well.
-Until the very end of the day.
-Until the very end of the day.

I actually was supposed
to be Brooklyn.

And we didn't get in
trouble because they

thought it was funny,
so that's good.

-But we're going to
try and switch again.

Not telling you guys
when, but we will.

-Well, you just told
everybody so now they're all--

-Maybe we'll tell
them that we switched

-Thinks we're switched,
but we really didn't.

-If that can get any more
confusing, there you go.

All right, do we have
twinepathy, or twin telepathy--
however you want to call it?
We should make a video on that.

-And sometimes we'll come
into the same room singing

the exact same song with
the exact same tune,

I mean, obviously we say
things at the same time.
It's because twins share a mind.

-So when people ask us
questions or say something,

-We'll have the same
thought at the same time.

-Okie dokie, let's see on
my handy dandy sticky note.

The next question
is, do we share pain?

So like if I went to pinch
her, would I feel it?
OK, I'm going to pinch myself.
I feel-- no, it doesn't work.

-I didn't feel anything,
so that's all good for me.

People always, always
ask me this question,
do you feel each other's pain?

-It's like if I were to hit you,
does that boy across the room

It's just-- no,
it doesn't happen.

-I mean, we share a
connection, but not
I mean, if she's like crying--

That's what you're
supposed to feel.

If I like slap myself,
she's not going to--

-We get almost to every
person who we ever

It's one of the
number one questions.

-Is like, I always
wish I had a twin.
Do you guys like being twins?

It's like having a
permanent best friend.

-It's like having
a shadow, sort of,

that just kind of follows you
everywhere and does everything

I mean, we may seem like
it in the beginning.

But then when you get to know
us a bit, it's like, whoa,
you are not the same person.

So you introduce
yourself to them

and they just can't
seem to remember you.

That's kind of what it feels
like when people confuse you,

-It kind of, at the beginning,
it's OK when you guys meet us.

But if it's my mom
or dad or sister

and they call me the wrong
name, then it's like--

-Yeah, you know, you've
lived with us for 14 years.

I mean, you have to
kind of live with it.

-Calling us the wrong
name is something

that just comes
with being twins.

-You just have to kind
of get used to it.

So it's like one
of those questions
Just got to get used to it.

-The next question is, what
is the difference between us?

And this is kind of something
we reviewed in our Q&A.

It's just a difference in
how we-- I don't even know.

And she's a tom girl,
which mean she's
kind of sporty, kind of girly.

I'm all about the fashion,
the writing, the photography,

the earrings, the
makeup, the hair.

-Converse, and footballs,
and soccer, and basketball.

You just kind of
have to meet us--

-You just kind of have
to get to know us.
When you meet us you'll know.

-Who takes longer to get
ready in the morning?

But, you know, I
take longer than her.

We get up at 6:00 every morning
because our bus comes at 7:55.

And it's like 7:30 by the
time I get in the bathroom.
-I don't take it that long, OK?

-The next question is, choose
one word to describe the other.

My word for her would be
probably outgoing, or brave,

She really just puts
herself out there

and makes a ton of friends
and is really brave,

does a lot of things I
probably couldn't do.

Yeah, that would
be my word for you.
Do you have one for me?
Well, actually, I have a couple.

-OK, so my first
one is friendly.

And my second one
is-- this is not

-Because I couldn't
really think of one word
that would fit Bailey in it.
Do you get what I'm saying?

-I can't tell if this is
going to be positive--

-There's so many positive
things that a well-rounded--

-I just have too much
of a big personality
to fit in a tiny word.

One thing that bothers
you about the other?

No, I'm not moving,
because I'm bossy.

But you wouldn't know that,
because she doesn't act bossy

- --you would not-- yeah, I
tell her this all the time
because it bothers me so much.

Bailey-- it may not seem
like it, this innocent,

But she is the messiest
person you will ever meet.

-When she's trying to find
an outfit in the morning,

she'll put a bunch
of clothes on.

She'll throw them
all on the floor

so there's like a
mountain in the closet.

-And then it's like
the mess is left for me
and that's why I'm so bossy.

I'm like, you can't
leave this for me.
You have to help me clean it.

OK, our favorite and
least favorite thing

be always having someone
who's your friend.

And then my least favorite would
probably be sharing everything.

My least favorite is when
people treat us as one person.

-My parents have a
habit of doing this,

-And my parents will make both
of us take the punishment.

-And it's like I understand
we're twins and stuff,

We make separate choices,
separate decisions,

We're separate
people, so we should

-But my favorite part
about being a twin

is having a best friend,
permanent best friend.

It's like living with your
best friend permanently.

-Which has an upside
and a downside.

-That is the end
of our twin trivia.

Thank you guys so much
for watching this video.

Be sure to like, share
and favorite this video.

-Feel free to leave a
comment below on anymore

questions you have for
us about being twins.

And be sure to watch next
week, and we'll see you later.

And the bedding and all the
pillows are from Pottery Barn.

And we made this arrangement
because in our old room

comments.text:
Hi,
I also have a twin but she hates me😥. She thinks she is so much better 
than me because she has blonde hair, blue eyes, and is cheer captain while 
I'm in the band She is also very popular. I can't tell you how many mean 
things she has done to me. One of them was I told her about this guy I have 
a crush on. He is very shy snd reserve and usually only talks to me. And 
the next day at school she asked him out. Unfortunately he said yes ( 
because he was scared of what would happen if he didn't) and she dumped him 
2 weeks later. So now he talks to no one not even me. She calls me names in 
the hall at school. And last year when we turned 12 she had a sleepover. I 
was supposed to have my own b day party, she said " why are you having a 
party you have no friends anyway" uh I was soooooo mad. All in all twins 
can be a blessing or a curse. ﻿

comments.text:
Hey Brooklyn and Bailey My name is Tatiana Grant and I'm a twin as well. I 
have a twin sister named Tiana but its pronounced Tyanna. We just turned 19 
on April 9th. We not fraternal or identical we are called discordant twins 
meaning one twin eats more and the other gets less. When we were born it 
was C section cause I was breech. I came out first and I'm the shortest. 
Tiana came out 11 minutes later and she ate more than I did and I ate less. 
I was 1 pound and Tiana was 4 pounds at birth.﻿
comments.author: Tatiana Grant
